content:
NativeActivityMetadata Struct

Definition

Represents the set of arguments, child activities, variables, and delegates that a configured NativeActivity introduces to the execution environment.

In this Article

public struct NativeActivityMetadata
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
NativeActivityMetadata

Properties

Environment

Gets the activity’s LocationReferenceEnvironment of arguments, variables, delegate arguments, or symbols introduced by a SymbolResolver.

public System.Activities.LocationReferenceEnvironment Environment { get; }
Value
LocationReferenceEnvironment

The activity’s location reference environment of arguments, variables, delegate arguments, or symbols introduced by a SymbolResolver.

HasViolations

Gets a value that indicates whether there are any validation errors in the metadata.

public bool HasViolations { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if validation errors are present; otherwise, false.

Methods

AddArgument(RuntimeArgument)

Adds an argument to the collection of arguments of an activity.

public void AddArgument (System.Activities.RuntimeArgument argument);
argument
RuntimeArgument

The argument to add to the collection.

AddChild(Activity)

Adds the specified activity to the metadata’s list of child activities.

public void AddChild (System.Activities.Activity child);
child
Activity

The activity to add.

Remarks

An activity added using AddChild is a child activity that the parent activity can schedule directly. These activities are to be provided by the consumer of the activity. An example of this is the Activities collection of a Sequence activity. These activities (and any activities they add using AddChild or AddImportedChild) have access to variables added through AddVariable.

AddChild(Activity,Object)

Adds the specified activity to the metadata’s list of child activities.

public void AddChild (System.Activities.Activity child, object origin);
child
Activity

The activity to add.

origin
Object

The origin of the activity.

AddDefaultExtensionProvider<T>(Func<T>)

Adds the specified extension provider to the collection of default extension providers for the activity.

public void AddDefaultExtensionProvider<T> (Func<T> extensionProvider) where T : class;
extensionProvider
Func<T>

The function that returns the extension.

Remarks

If the host does not provide an extension of type T, then this extension provider is evaluated to provide one.

AddDelegate(ActivityDelegate)

Adds the specified delegate to the metadata’s list of delegates.

public void AddDelegate (System.Activities.ActivityDelegate activityDelegate);
activityDelegate
ActivityDelegate

The delegate to add.

AddDelegate(ActivityDelegate,Object)

Adds the specified delegate to the metadata’s list of delegates.

public void AddDelegate (System.Activities.ActivityDelegate activityDelegate, object origin);
activityDelegate
ActivityDelegate

The delegate to add.

origin
Object

The origin of the delegate.

AddImplementationChild(Activity)

Adds the specified activity to the metadata’s list of implementation activities.

public void AddImplementationChild (System.Activities.Activity implementationChild);
implementationChild
Activity

The activity to add.

Remarks

An activity added using AddImplementationChild is a child activity that the parent activity can schedule directly. These activities are implementation details of the activity. These activities (and any activities they add using AddChild or AddImportedChild) have access to this activity’s arguments as well as variables added through AddImplementationVariable.

AddImplementationDelegate(ActivityDelegate)

Adds the specified delegate to the metadata’s list of implementation delegates.

public void AddImplementationDelegate (System.Activities.ActivityDelegate implementationDelegate);
implementationDelegate
ActivityDelegate

The delegate to add.

AddImplementationVariable(Variable)

Adds the specified variable to the metadata’s collection of implementation variables.

public void AddImplementationVariable (System.Activities.Variable implementationVariable);
implementationVariable
Variable

The variable to add.

AddImportedChild(Activity)

Adds the specified activity to the metadata’s list of imported child activities.

public void AddImportedChild (System.Activities.Activity importedChild);
importedChild
Activity

The activity to add.

Remarks

An imported child activity is a child activity that the parent activity does not schedule directly. Rather, then parent uses this activity to configure some other child activity.

AddImportedChild(Activity,Object)

Adds the specified activity to the metadata’s list of imported child activities.

public void AddImportedChild (System.Activities.Activity importedChild, object origin);
importedChild
Activity

The activity to add.

origin
Object

The origin of the activity.

AddImportedDelegate(ActivityDelegate)

Adds the specified delegate to the metadata’s list of imported delegates.

public void AddImportedDelegate (System.Activities.ActivityDelegate importedDelegate);
importedDelegate
ActivityDelegate

The delegate to add.

AddImportedDelegate(ActivityDelegate,Object)

Adds the specified delegate to the metadata’s list of imported delegates.

public void AddImportedDelegate (System.Activities.ActivityDelegate importedDelegate, object origin);
importedDelegate
ActivityDelegate

The delegate to add.

origin
Object

The origin of the delegate.

AddValidationError(ValidationError)

Adds the specified validation error to the metadata’s collection of validation errors.

public void AddValidationError (System.Activities.Validation.ValidationError validationError);
validationError
ValidationError

The validation error to add.

Remarks

For more information, see Imperative Code-Based Validation.

AddValidationError(String)

Adds a validation error to the metadata’s collection of validation errors using the specified description.

public void AddValidationError (string validationErrorMessage);
validationErrorMessage
String

A message that describes the validation error.

Remarks

For more information, see Imperative Code-Based Validation.

AddVariable(Variable)

Adds the specified variable to the metadata’s collection of variables.

public void AddVariable (System.Activities.Variable variable);
variable
Variable

The variable to add.

Remarks

Variables added using this method are considered part of the activity’s publicly configurable surface, that is, they are to be provided by the consumer of the activity. An activity’s implementation cannot access variables added using this method. Activities added through AddImportedChild or AddChild (and any of their non-implementation child activities) can access variables added using this method.

AddVariable(Variable,Object)

Adds the specified variable to the metadata’s collection of variables.

public void AddVariable (System.Activities.Variable variable, object origin);
variable
Variable

The variable to add.

origin
Object

The origin of the variable.

Bind(Argument,RuntimeArgument)

Binds the specified Argument to the specified RuntimeArgument.

public void Bind (System.Activities.Argument binding, System.Activities.RuntimeArgument argument);
binding
Argument

The Argument to bind.

argument
RuntimeArgument

The RuntimeArgument to bind.

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified object is equal to this metadata instance.

public override bool Equals (object obj);
obj
Object

The object to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified object is equal to this metadata instance; otherwise, false.

GetArgumentsWithReflection()

Returns a collection of arguments obtained by using reflection.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.RuntimeArgument> GetArgumentsWithReflection ();
Returns
Collection<RuntimeArgument>

A collection of arguments.

Remarks

This method uses an activity’s TypeDescriptor to examine all public properties of type Argument and returns them in a collection.

GetChildrenWithReflection()

Returns a collection of child activities using reflection.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Activity> GetChildrenWithReflection ();
Returns
Collection<Activity>

A collection of child activities.

Remarks

This method uses an activity’s TypeDescriptor to examine all public properties of type Activity, or IList<T> or ICollection<T> where T derives from Activity, and returns them in a collection.

GetDelegatesWithReflection()

Returns a collection of delegates using reflection.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.ActivityDelegate> GetDelegatesWithReflection ();
Returns
Collection<ActivityDelegate>

A collection of delegates.

Remarks

This method uses an activity’s TypeDescriptor to examine all public properties of type ActivityDelegate, or IList<T> or ICollection<T> where T derives from ActivityDelegate, and returns them in a collection.

GetHashCode()

Returns a unique identifier for this metadata instance.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

An integer that uniquely identifies this metadata instance.

GetVariablesWithReflection()

Returns a collection of variables using reflection.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Variable> GetVariablesWithReflection ();
Returns
Collection<Variable>

A collection of variables.

Remarks

This method uses an activity’s TypeDescriptor to examine all public properties of type Variable, or IList<T> or ICollection<T> where T derives from Variable, and returns them in a collection.

RequireExtension(Type)

Specifies that the activity requires an extension of the specified type at runtime.

public void RequireExtension (Type extensionType);
extensionType
Type

The type of the extension.

Remarks

If the host fails to provide an extension of the specified type, validation fails.

RequireExtension<T>()

Specifies that the activity requires an extension of the specified generic type at runtime.

public void RequireExtension<T> () where T : class;

Remarks

If the host fails to provide an extension of the specified type, validation fails.

SetArgumentsCollection(Collection<RuntimeArgument>)

Adds the specified collection of arguments to the activity’s arguments.

public void SetArgumentsCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.RuntimeArgument> arguments);
arguments
Collection<RuntimeArgument>

The arguments to add.

SetChildrenCollection(Collection<Activity>)

Adds the specified collection as child activities of the activity.

public void SetChildrenCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Activity> children);
children
Collection<Activity>

The activities to add.

Remarks

This is the equivalent of calling AddChild for each item in the collection.

SetDelegatesCollection(Collection<ActivityDelegate>)

Adds the specified collection as delegates of the activity.

public void SetDelegatesCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.ActivityDelegate> delegates);
delegates
Collection<ActivityDelegate>

The delegates to add.

Remarks

This is the equivalent of calling AddDelegate for each item in the collection.

SetImplementationChildrenCollection(Collection<Activity>)

Adds the specified collection as implementation child activities of the activity.

public void SetImplementationChildrenCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Activity> implementationChildren);
implementationChildren
Collection<Activity>

The activities to add.

Remarks

This is the equivalent of calling AddImplementationChild for each item in the collection.

SetImplementationDelegatesCollection(Collection<ActivityDelegate>)

Adds the specified collection as implementation delegates of the activity.

public void SetImplementationDelegatesCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.ActivityDelegate> implementationDelegates);
implementationDelegates
Collection<ActivityDelegate>

The delegates to add.

Remarks

This is the equivalent of calling AddImplementationDelegate for each item in the collection.

SetImplementationVariablesCollection(Collection<Variable>)

Adds the specified collection as implementation variables of the activity.

public void SetImplementationVariablesCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Variable> implementationVariables);
implementationVariables
Collection<Variable>

The delegates to add.

Remarks

This is the equivalent of calling AddImplementationVariable for each item in the collection.

SetImportedChildrenCollection(Collection<Activity>)

Adds the specified collection as imported child activities of the activity.

public void SetImportedChildrenCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Activity> importedChildren);
importedChildren
Collection<Activity>

The activities to add.

Remarks

This is the equivalent of calling AddImportedChild for each item in the collection.

SetImportedDelegatesCollection(Collection<ActivityDelegate>)

Adds the specified collection as imported delegates of the activity.

public void SetImportedDelegatesCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.ActivityDelegate> importedDelegates);
importedDelegates
Collection<ActivityDelegate>

The delegates to add.

Remarks

This is the equivalent of calling AddImportedDelegate for each item in the collection.

SetValidationErrorsCollection(Collection<ValidationError>)

Adds the specified collection of validation errors to the metadata’s collection of validation errors.

public void SetValidationErrorsCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Validation.ValidationError> validationErrors);
validationErrors
Collection<ValidationError>

The validation errors to add.

SetVariablesCollection(Collection<Variable>)

Adds the specified collection of variables to the activity’s variables.

public void SetVariablesCollection (System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Variable> variables);
variables
Collection<Variable>

The variables to add.

Operators

op_Equality(NativeActivityMetadata,NativeActivityMetadata)

Returns a value that indicates whether the two specified metadata instances are equal.

public static bool op_Equality (System.Activities.NativeActivityMetadata left, System.Activities.NativeActivityMetadata right);
left
NativeActivityMetadata

The first item to compare.

right
NativeActivityMetadata

The second item to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the two items are equal; otherwise, false.

op_Inequality(NativeActivityMetadata,NativeActivityMetadata)

Returns a value that indicates whether the two specified metadata instances are not equal.

public static bool op_Inequality (System.Activities.NativeActivityMetadata left, System.Activities.NativeActivityMetadata right);
left
NativeActivityMetadata

The first item to compare.

right
NativeActivityMetadata

The second item to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the two items are not equal; otherwise, false.

rawMetadata.description: Represents the set of arguments, child activities, variables, and delegates that a configured  introduces to the execution environment.
